results.title: Southeast Asia: Malaysia and Singapore
results.brief_description: Most of the people in Malaysia are farmers, fishermen or miners. Most of the people of Singapore are merchants, importers and exporters, or factory workers. In both countries most of the people are Malay, Chinese, Indian and Pakistani. But in spite of the ethnic similarities, Malaysia and Singapore are strikingly different.

results.title: Southeast Asia: Burma and Thailand
results.brief_description: Burma and Thailand are similar in their geography and in the ways of life of their people. Old traditions guide much of the life of the people of both countries. However, both Rangoon and Bangkok are modern-looking. This film examines the similarities of the two countries.

results.title: Southeast Asia: a culture history
results.creator_credit: Sigma Educational Films and Arthur Niehoff
results.brief_description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: South: Sir Ernest Shackleton's glorious epic....
results.brief_description: Photographed by Frank Hurley, ‘South’ is the film record of Sir Ernest Shackleton’s heroic but ill-starred attempt to cross Antarctica in 1914-16. It is both a historical document, and a tribute to the indomitable courage of the 28 men who set out on a voyage of discovery that turned into an epic struggle for survival. Silent with original music by Neil Brand.

results.title: South with Shackleton (1914)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Robinson
results.brief_description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: South West Tasmania: The Gliders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Millar, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
The sheer challenge of remote wilderness is shown in this spectacular program of a group’s arduous trek up Federation Peak with the aim of hang gliding from the top. Young and old take part in the trek and viewers share in the thoughts, inspiration and differing goals of the group.

results.title: South to North
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Using dramatised re-enactments as well as historical footage and documents, Bill Peach narrates this investigation of the race to cross Australia from South to North. The race was driven by colonial rivalry between New South Wales and Victoria, resulting in John McDougall Stuart eventually emerging through the centre of the North Coast at the Gulf of Carpentaria.

results.title: South Park: bigger, longer & uncut [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Paramount Pictures, Trey Parker and Matt Stone
results.brief_description: The boys from the American cult television program South Park launched onto the big screen in 1999 with their first feature length film ‘Bigger Longer and Uncut’, a cleverly written musical film looking at censorship and the influence film and television has on child development. Created by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park follows the misadventures of friends Stan Marsh, Kyle Broflovski, Kenny McCormick and Eric Cartman in a small town called South Park in Colorado. Alien abductions, giant Barbra Streisand monsters and poor Kenny being killed episode after episode are just a few things the foul-mouthed boys have to deal with. When the boys see an R film starring Canadian icons ‘Terrance and Philip’, their parents become distressed at the language the boys are using. Rather than take responsibility for not supervising their children, the parents choose to blame Canada, and arrest Terrance and Philip, causing an USA v Canada war. With Terrance and Philip’s lives at stake, the boys create an underground children’s resistance, aptly named ‘La Resistance’ to free their Canadian idols before they are executed. The films subplot explores relationships, including Stan’s unusual relationship with classmate Wendy Testeburger, and her new found affection for a boy who is ‘political’. South Park character favourites Mr Garrison, Mr Mackey, Chef and Officer Barbrady also make appearance, as does Saddam Hussein, Satan and Winona Ryder. Parker and Stone’s clever soundtrack, spoofing a number of popular musicals including ‘Les Miserables’ and ‘The Sound of Music’ in addition to their own musical creations, earned them an Oscar nomination for Best Song (“Blame Canada’) in 2000. Features the voices of Isaac Hayes, Minnie Driver, Eric Idle and George Clooney. Warning: CONTAINS COARSE LANGUAGE.

results.title: South Park Rally for PlayStation
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Tantalus Media
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in CD jewel case with insert
results.brief_description: Based on the popular TV series, this kart-tyle racing game includes many of the characters from the show’s first two seasons. These include series mainstays like Stan, Kyle, Eric and Kenny to more unique characters like Mr. Garrison, Dr. Mephesto, and Terrance and Phillip, which have to be unlocked. While racing, a player can pick up different coloured boxes with a set of randomised items that can be used to boost the player or hinder other players. Other competitive game modes include variations of tag, collecting special items and delivering objects before other players do. Series creators Matt Stone and Trey Parker were not involved in the development of the game, but did provide voice work for the characters.
